title: Enate 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Somontano)
description: Dry spicy aromas of tree bark accent basic red-fruit scents. In the mouth, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is tight as a drum and racy. Narrow tangy flavors of plum finish peppery, lean and scrubbing.

title: Finca la Malena 2016 Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: A mild nose with little extravagance offers modest lemon aromas. The palate on this light-bodied white holds onto that lemony character via pithy, somewhat yeasty citrus flavors. The short non-effusive finish is tangy.

title: Firestone 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Squeezed lime, wet concrete and green apple rind scents show on the nose of this basic bottling. Kaffir lime tang meets with ripe red apple and pear notes on the palate, framed by a stony texture.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Pigmentum Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Apricots and honey mark this wine. It is just off dry, just hinting at sweetness, more to do with soft perfumed fruit. It's a great apéritif style with its fruity character. Drink now.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Pigmentum Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a blend of 60% Ugni Blanc and 40% Colombard that gives a deliciously light and refreshing wine. Bright and breezy, it is perfumed, herbal and full of direct citrus flavors. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Monte da Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: Made by Leonor Freitas in the family winery, this is a rich blend of Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Syrah. With its firm tannins balanced by juicy red fruit, it's a wine to savor from early 2018.

title: DeLorimier 2014 Osborn Ranch Primitivo (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoke, brawny black pepper and black cherry flavors meet on the palate of this intensely ripe wine. It's grippy and high-octane in power, with a layering of mocha dust.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2014 Dulce Tinto Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of brandied cherry and crème de cassis include a horsey sidenote and some heat. This sweet Monastrell smacks the palate with hard tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis and baked plum finish blocky.

title: Casarena 2013 Reservado Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Exotic berry and spice aromas are reserved, as the name of the wine implies. On the palate, this is blocky, heavy and jammy. Concentrated flavors of plum and currant are a bit stewed and tomatoey. On the finish, this is dense and tannic, with savory stewy flavors.

title: Black Elephant 2015 Two Dogs A Peacock And A Horse Sauvignon Blanc (Franschhoek)
description: This is a bright and lively selection, with assertive aromas and flavors of green melon, lime and gooseberry. Lightweight, bright and nervy, it boasts mouthwatering acidity, tart citrus-driven flavors and a lingering fresh-grass accent on the close. Drink now.
designation: Two Dogs A Peacock And A Horse

title: Bota Box 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This boxed Malbec is burgundy-colored and opens with spicy reedy aromas of dried herbs and red-berry fruits. On the palate, this is tight but shallow in the midtier. Flavors of baked plum and berry fruits come with a note of cocoa powder prior to a stable finish.

title: Eberle 2015 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is ripe and tropical but approachable on the nose, with honeydew melon, banana and nectarine aromas. There is a decent punch of acidity and noticeable texture upon first sip, veering toward sweet apple and bubblegum flavors on the finish.

title: Guenoc 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This straightforward, affordable dry wine is good and fruity, with medium body, moderate tannins and plenty of red cherry and blackberry flavors.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2013 Syrah (South Coast)
description: There's a touch of barnyard on the nose of this bottling, which also shows a soy and sweet black cherry scents. The palate is marked by beef char and cooked black fruit flavors, with a twist of funkiness, lending intrigue.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2016 Viognier (South Coast)
description: Juicy kiwi, lime blossom and sour apple candy aromas show on the nose of this ripe white—the first 2016 submitted from the region. The palate is oily in texture, with honeydew and more lime-kiwi-bubblegum flavors.

title: Hestan 2011 Stephanie Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brambly and herbal, this wine shows bright acidity underlying a full-bodied, incoherently ripe palate of tar, toffee and rich cola notes.

title: Orsi Family Vineyards 2013 Barbera (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This dull, rustic wine offers earth and anise flavors around a core of soft cherry fruit. Light bodied, its acidity is moderate and unobtrusive.

title: Ironstone 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Smoky, toasted walnut aromas and oaky flavors make this full-bodied wine taste like the volume is turned up loud. It feels firmly tannic and broad on the palate, its toasted oak qualities coating the mouth and lingering on the finish.

title: Fenestra NV True Red Lot 30 Red (California)
description: Spicy oak nuances and maturity give this full-bodied wine a broad range of peppery, leathery, cedary aromas and mellow flavors reminiscent of milk chocolate and tamarind. It's rustic but fun to taste.

title: Lucky Frog 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)
description: Floral white-fruit aromas are yeasty and lack intensity. This feels mildly citric, with basic lime and green-apple flavors. A tangy easy simple finish sends this quaffable SB on its way.

title: Finca Las Moras 2016 Alma Mora Sauvignon Blanc (San Juan)
description: Although this San Juan SB offers almost nothing on the nose, it's fresh and popping with acidity on the palate. Flavors of briny citrus are entirely familiar, while this finishes with cleansing crispness.

title: Piña 2014 Low Vineyard Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: The caramel oakiness of this wine is offset by austere structure and a focused midpalate, the flavors leaning toward cool-climate green apple and kumquat. It returns to richness and intensity on the finish.

title: Latah Creek 2015 DenHoed Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: Starting off slightly reduced, this wine has aromas of dried red apple that lead to just off-dry, full apple flavors, finishing bitter.

title: Millbrook 2015 Castle Hill Vineyard Riesling (Hudson River Region)
description: Savory apples and pears mingle into lemon and bramble in this slightly earthy off-dry Riesling. Sunny tangerine acidity is easy but bright, leading a delicately sweet finish.

title: Opta 2014 Red (Dão)
description: This is an open and fruity wine, made to be drunk young. With its wood-derived spice notes, black currant fruitiness and acidity, it's balanced, elegant and ready to drink now.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2014 Oculto Red (Tejo)
description: This wine comes from the northern reaches of Tejo, giving it a structured, cool and bright, fruity character. Juicy acidity cuts through its tannins and black plum flavor. Needing a few more months of bottle age, it will be ready to drink in 2018.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2015 Assobio Red (Douro)
description: The Douro venture of Alentejo-based Herdade do Esporão, this wine is structured with tannin while also having generous red berry fruit. Acidity, mineral texture and a bright aftertaste give it both weight and crispness. Drink now.

title: Rubinna 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Robust and sanguine, this softly layered wine offers a simple take on the variety—a study in blackberry, leather and peppercorn flavors.

title: Rive Droite Rive Gauche 2015 White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: From a small cave cooperative in Laudun, this is a solid Rhône white blend of 55% Grenache Blanc, 40% Bourboulenc and 5% Clairette. It's a full-bodied, slightly oily wine, delivering pear, melon and pineapple flavors tinged with cinnamon and brown sugar. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Red (Tejo)
description: This state-owned estate of forests and vineyards grows organic grapes. This wine, softly structured and ripe has light black fruits and plenty of acidity. An undercurrent of tannin keeps the wine in order and will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard
